question.name: B1
question.text: The aim of risk management at an air rifle range is:
question.correctans: to identify what can cause harm and plan ways to minimize that harm
question.choices: to increase the efficiency of the activity|to identify what can cause harm and plan ways to minimize that harm|to make the activity more fun and challenging for participants|to maintain good order and discipline

question.name: B2
question.text: Your corps/squadron is building a permanent outdoor air rifle range. There's not enough room for the 250m danger template, so a backstop with a butt and 3m side wings on each side must be built. How high do the butt and side wings need to be?

question.name: B3
question.text: CATO 14-41 states that the major design considerations in the establishment of a range site are: (check all that apply)
question.correctans: containment of fired pellets,controlled access into the range area,lighting that allows for a clear view from firing point to targets
question.choices: containment of fired pellets|controlled access into the range area|close to a hospital|lighting that allows for a clear view from firing point to targets

question.name: B4
question.text: On the command 'Adopt the prone position" the shooters can get their equipment set up, adjust their position and load a pellet into the rifle"

question.name: B5
question.text: Put these range commands in order:
question.correctans: Cover off your firing point,Change flag/light to red,Load, commence firing,Change targets
question.choices: Cover off your firing point|Change flag/light to red|Load, commence firing|Change targets
